title: Chikungunya wave hits Sri Lanka: Are you at risk?
byline: Sri Lanka is experiencing a rapid spread of Chikungunya, a mosquito-borne viral disease, with cases reported from various parts of the country.

title: Second lot of vehicles for domestic market discharged from HIP
byline: The Hambantota International Port (HIP) successfully discharged the second batch of vehicles for the domestic market last week.

title: Tourism Ministry announces advisory committee sans female representation
byline: The Tourism Ministry yesterday officially announced the appointment of a 13-member Tourism Advisory Committee, with no female representation.

title: BYD’s first shipment arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: In a momentous event for Sri Lanka’s automotive landscape, the first shipment of BYD’s cutting-edge new energy vehicles (NEVs) has arrived at the Hambantota Port.

title: Dayasiri, Handunetti engage in verbal battle in Parliament
byline: SJB MP Dayasiri Jayasekara and Minister of Industries Sunil Handunetti engaged in a verbal battle in Parliament during the oral question session.

title: Heathrow Airport closes all day over power outage
byline: Heathrow Airport is closing all day Friday because of a large fire at a nearby electrical substation that supplies it.

title: Tesla makes largest ever Cybertruck recall
byline: Thousands of Tesla Cybertrucks have been recalled in the US due to concerns about part of the electric car’s trim falling off in the model’s eighth and largest ever recall.

title: Trump signs order to begin dismantling of US education department
byline: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order to dismantle the Department of Education, fulfilling a campaign pledge and a long-cherished goal of some conservatives.

title: Customs misclassifying SUVs like Nissan X-Trail, Toyota Raize: VIASL
byline: President of the Vehicle Importers’ Association of Sri Lanka (VIASL) Prasad Manage claimed today that an issue has arisen at the Sri Lanka Customs Department, as the Nissan X-Trail and Toyota Raize, classified as hybrid SUVs by Japan Customs, have been identified as non-hybrid vehicles by Sri Lanka Customs.

title: BIA welcomes Bulgaria Air charter flight
byline: The Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) today welcomed a special charter flight from Bulgaria Air, the Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited (AASL) said.

title: Never accepted funds from Arjun Aloysius: Dayasiri
byline: Opposition MP Dayasiri Jayasekara today denied that he had accepted funds from Perpetual Treasuries owned by Arjun Aloysius.

title: Tense situation at Polduwa junction
byline: A tense situation occurred at Polduwa Junction near the Parliament access road following a protest by unemployed graduates, police said.

title: SLAF appoints special committee to probe K-8 trainer jet crash
byline: The Commander of the Sri Lanka Air Force, Air Marshal Bandu Edirisinghe, has appointed a special investigation committee to probe the crash of the K-8 trainer jet.

title: Police probe finger chopping incident during drinking session
byline: Kalutara South Police are investigating into an incident where a man allegedly chopped off a friend’s finger during a drinking session.

title: French tourist injured in fall at Punchi Sri Pada
byline: A French tourist visiting Punchi Sri Pada (Mini Adam’s Peak) slipped and fell from the mountain, sustaining serious injuries.

title: Gary Anandasangaree appointed Canadian Justice Minister
byline: Gary Anandasangaree, a Jaffna-born Tamil Canadian, has been appointed as Canada’s Minister of Justice and Attorney-General (MoJAG) in the newly formed cabinet of Prime Minister Mark Carney on March 14 2025, during the swearing-in ceremony at Rideau Hall, Ottawa.

title: Elon Musk’s X sues India in new censorship battle
byline: India’s IT ministry has unlawfully expanded censorship powers to allow the easier removal of online content and empowered “countless” government officials to execute such orders, Elon Musk’s X has alleged in a new lawsuit against New Delhi.

title: Chinese K-8 trainer jet crashes in Wariyapola
byline: A Chinese K-8 trainer jet of the Sri Lanka Air Force crash-landed in Wariyapola a short while ago, the Sri Lanka Air Force reported.

title: Tunisian president sacks prime minister amid economic and migration crisis
byline: Tunisian President Kais Saied sacked Prime Minister Kamel Maddouri less than a year after his appointment, and named Sara Zaafarani as his replacement, amid a faltering economy and a worsening flood of migrants from Sub-Saharan Africa countries.

title: Central Bank lists Pro Care, Shade of Procare among prohibited schemes
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka has determined that Pro Care (Pvt) Ltd. and Shade of Procare (Pvt) Ltd. are engaged in a scheme prohibited under Section 83(C) of the Banking Act, No. 30 of 1988, as amended.

title: LG polls: Over 400 nominations rejected
byline: Nearly 425 nomination papers have been rejected in this year’s local government election nominations.

title: SriLankan cancels flights due to Heathrow closure
byline: Due to the temporary closure of Heathrow Airport following a large fire at a nearby electrical substation, SriLankan Airlines flights UL 503 (Colombo to London), scheduled for 12:50 hrs, and UL 504 (London to Colombo), scheduled for 20:40 hrs on 21 March 2025, will not operate.

title: German woman’s nomination for Local Elections rejected
byline: The nomination of a German woman who was set to contest the upcoming Local Government Elections in the Matale District has been rejected.
